name: 4-cyano-4'-n-heptyloxybiphenyl
Reason: 4-cyano-4'-n-heptyloxybiphenyl has a melting point that we can predict by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is biphenyl, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The introduction of the heptyloxy group (–OCH2CH2CH2CH2CH2CH2) adds approximately +10°C due to increased molecular weight and the presence of hydroxyl groups, which can participate in hydrogen bonding. The cyano group (–CN) raises the melting point by approximately +5°C due to increased molecular weight and the presence of a dipole moment, which can participate in hydrogen bonding. The heptyloxy group (–OCH2CH2CH2CH2CH2CH2) adds approximately +10°C due to increased molecular weight and the presence of hydroxyl groups, which can participate in hydrogen bonding.
